item.title: Blackstone 从 Atlantic Union Bankshares 购买 20 亿美元的 CRE 贷款
item.description: 另类资产管理公司 Blackstone 周四表示，已从 Atlantic Union Bankshares 购买了价值近 20 亿美元的商业房地产贷款。【原文：Alternative asset manager Blackstone has bought commercial real estate loans worth nearly $2 billion from Atlantic Union Bankshares , the companies said on Thursday.】

item.title: 在医疗保险举报人诉讼案中，CVS 部门被勒令支付 9500 万美元
item.description: CVS Health 的药房福利管理部门必须向美国政府支付 9500 万美元，因为联邦法官裁定该部门多收了医疗保险处方药的费用。【原文：CVS Health's pharmacy benefit manager unit must pay the U.S. government $95 million after a federal judge found it overcharged Medicare for prescription drugs.】

item.title: Revolut 将收购法国巴黎银行旗下的阿根廷贷款公司以拓展市场
item.description: 总部位于伦敦的金融科技巨头 Revolut 周四表示，将收购法国巴黎银行在阿根廷拥有的一家当地贷款机构，这标志着这家数字银行进军拉美的最新举措。【原文：London-based fintech giant Revolut will acquire a local lender owned by BNP Paribas in Argentina, it said on Thursday, marking the digital bank's latest foray into Latin America.】

item.title: 特朗普称周三已与中国签署贸易协议
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普周四表示，美国于周三与中国签署了一项与贸易有关的协议，但他没有具体说明协议的内容。【原文：President Donald Trump said on Thursday the United States signed an agreement with China on Wednesday related to trade but he did not specify what he was talking about.】

item.title: 官员称欧盟收到美国新贸易协定 "大纲
item.description: 欧洲官员周四表示，美国已向欧盟委员会提交了一份新的贸易协定提案，欧盟委员会主席已与欧盟领导人分享了该提案。【原文：The United States has presented a new proposal for a trade agreement to the European Commission, whose chief has shared it with EU leaders, European officials said on Thursday.】

item.title: 耐克季度收入降幅低于预期
item.description: 耐克公司周四公布的第四季度营收降幅小于预期，这主要得益于市场对其新产品的需求以及传统运动鞋系列的折扣。【原文：Nike reported a smaller-than-expected drop in fourth-quarter revenue on Thursday, helped by demand for its newer products as well as discounts on its legacy sneaker lines.】

item.title: 贝森特说他要求立法者从美国预算法案中删除税收提案
item.description: 美国财政部长斯科特-贝森特（Scott Bessent）周四表示，在与其他国家达成协议后，他已要求参众两院从预算法案中删除被称为第 899 款的税收提案。【原文：U.S. Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said on Thursday that he has asked the Senate and the House to remove a tax proposal known as Section 899 from the budget bill after an agreement with other countries.】

item.title: 星巴克选举两名董事进入董事会
item.description: 星巴克周四表示，已选举经济学家丹比萨-莫约（Dambisa Moyo）和一家人工智能初创公司的首席执行官玛丽莎-梅耶尔（Marissa Mayer）进入董事会，并于6月25日生效。【原文：Starbucks said on Thursday it had elected economist Dambisa Moyo and Marissa Mayer, CEO of an AI startup, to its board, effective June 25.】

item.title: 美国联邦贸易委员会称，Alimentation Couche-Tard 必须剥离 35 家加油站才能推进巨人鹰的交易
item.description: 美国联邦贸易委员会（Federal Trade Commission）周四表示，加拿大零售商 Alimentation Couche-Tard 将被要求剥离 35 家加油站，以便推进其斥资 15.7 亿美元从连锁杂货店 Giant Eagle 收购 270 家零售加油站的计划。【原文：Canadian retailer Alimentation Couche-Tard will be required to divest 35 gas stations in order to move forward with its proposed $1.57 billion acquisition of 270 retail fuel outlets from grocery store chain Giant Eagle, the Federal Trade Commission said on Thursday.】

item.title: 特朗普有意接替鲍威尔，市场押注美联储将更加鸽派
item.description: 投资者表示，美联储预计到2026年底的利率水平与金融市场届时更激进的降息预期之间存在差距，部分原因是预计明年美国央行行长杰罗姆-鲍威尔（Jerome Powell）将被更鸽派的人取代。【原文：The gulf between where the Federal Reserve projects interest rates will be by the end of 2026 and the more aggressive cutting financial markets expect by then is partly due to the expectation that U.S. central bank chief Jerome Powell will be replaced by somebody more dovish next year, investors said.】

item.title: 联邦通信委员会主席未就特朗普移动电话与白宫进行讨论
item.description: 美国联邦通信委员会（Federal Communications Commission）负责人周四表示，他没有与白宫讨论过特朗普组织的自主品牌移动服务和一款售价 499 美元、被称为特朗普移动（Trump Mobile）的智能手机。【原文：The head of the U.S. Federal Communications Commission said on Thursday he had no discussions with the White House about the Trump Organization's self-branded mobile service and a $499 smartphone dubbed Trump Mobile.】

item.title: 摩根大通聘请资深交易员迪亚曼达基斯加深与金融赞助商的联系
item.description: 根据路透社周四看到的一份备忘录，摩根大通已聘请 Anthony Diamandakis 担任其战略投资者集团的副主席，以加强与资产管理公司和金融赞助商的联系。【原文：J.P. Morgan has hired Anthony Diamandakis as the vice chair of its strategic investors group as it ramps up its push to strengthen ties with asset managers and financial sponsors, according to a memo seen by Reuters on Thursday.】

item.title: 苹果公司修改欧盟应用程序商店规则以遵守反垄断命令
item.description: 苹果公司周四修改了其在欧盟的应用程序商店（App Store）的规则和收费标准，因为该集团的反垄断监管机构命令苹果公司消除向商店外发送客户的商业障碍。【原文：Apple on Thursday changed rules and fees in its App Store in the European Union after the bloc's antitrust regulators ordered it to remove commercial barriers to sending customers outside the store.】

item.title: 墨西哥监管机构接管受美国芬太尼制裁影响的银行业务
item.description: 墨西哥银行业监管机构周四表示，将临时介入取代因涉嫌参与与有组织犯罪有关的洗钱活动而被美国制裁的两家银行的管理。【原文：Mexico's banking regulator will temporarily step in to replace the administration of two banks sanctioned by the U.S. for alleged involvement in money laundering linked to organized crime, it said on Thursday.】

item.title: 据媒体报道，安娜-温图尔将辞去《Vogue》主编一职
item.description: 据多家媒体报道，《Vogue》主编安娜-温图尔（Anna Wintour）周四告诉员工，她将为美国版《Vogue》寻找一位新的编辑内容负责人。【原文：Vogue editor-in-chief Anna Wintour on Thursday told employees that she will be seeking a new head of editorial content at American Vogue, according to several media reports.】

item.title: 美联储主席柯林斯：7 月前没有足够数据决定降息
item.description: 波士顿联邦储备银行行长苏珊-柯林斯（Susan Collins）周四表示，她认为7月份考虑降息还为时过早。【原文：Boston Federal Reserve Bank President Susan Collins on Thursday signaled she feels July would be too soon to considering cutting interest rates.】

item.title: 独家报道沃尔玛将关闭位于得克萨斯州的山姆会员店配送中心，数百名员工将受影响
item.description: 沃尔玛周四表示，它将关闭位于德克萨斯州沃斯堡的一家为其连锁仓储式俱乐部山姆会员店提供在线订单服务的履行中心，熟悉此事的消息人士称，此举可能会导致裁员。【原文：Walmart said on Thursday it is closing a fulfillment center that services online orders for its warehouse club chain Sam's Club in Fort Worth, Texas, and sources familiar with the matter said the move could result in job losses.】

item.title: 美联储主席巴尔表示银行必须管理气候风险
item.description: 美联储理事迈克尔-巴尔（Michael Barr）周四表示，美国央行需要确保银行像衡量和管理其他风险一样衡量和管理与气候相关的风险。【原文：Federal Reserve Governor Michael Barr on Thursday said the U.S. central bank needs to ensure that banks are measuring and managing climate-related risk as they do other risks.】

item.title: 特朗普政府 "没有迫在眉睫的计划 "补充国家紧急石油储备
item.description: 白宫发言人卡罗琳-利维特（Karoline Leavitt）周四表示，特朗普政府近期没有重新填充国家战略石油储备的计划。【原文：The Trump administration has no imminent plans for refilling the nation's Strategic Petroleum Reserve, White House spokeswoman Karoline Leavitt said on Thursday.】

item.title: 州长宣布德克萨斯州能源基金为 122 兆瓦天然气设施提供首笔贷款
item.description: 德克萨斯州州长格雷格-阿博特（Greg Abbott）周四宣布，第一份德克萨斯能源基金（TEF）贷款协议将用于资助德克萨斯州一座 122 兆瓦（MW）的天然气发电厂。【原文：Texas Governor Greg Abbott announced on Thursday that the first Texas Energy Fund (TEF) loan agreement will be used to fund a 122 megawatt (MW) natural gas power plant in Texas.】

item.title: 巴尔：美联储完全有能力静观关税走势
item.description: 美联储理事迈克尔-巴尔（Michael Barr）周四在讲话中表示，美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的关税可能会增加通胀，也可能会推高失业率。【原文：President Donald Trump's tariffs will likely increase inflation and could also drive up unemployment, Federal Reserve Governor Michael Barr said on Thursday in remarks that signaled that he - like most of his Fed colleagues - wants to wait for more clarity before making any interest-rate cuts.】

item.title: 锂产业哀叹低价与需求增长的 "悖论
item.description: 全球最大的锂生产商在本周举行的一次重要行业会议上表示，尽管对这种电池金属的需求持续攀升，但锂价却持续下滑，这是一个令人沮丧的 "悖论"，至少在2030年之前不可能得到解决。【原文：An ongoing slide in lithium prices even as demand for the battery metal continues to climb is a frustrating "paradox" not likely to be resolved before at least 2030, the world's largest producers told a major industry conference this week.】

item.title: 在 "星链 "申请许可证之际，马斯克致电黎巴嫩总统
item.description: 奥恩办公室周四发表声明说，亿万富翁、商人埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）与黎巴嫩总统约瑟夫-奥恩（Joseph Aoun）通了电话，讨论了在黎巴嫩提供马斯克庞大商业帝国的要素的问题。【原文：Billionaire businessman Elon Musk and Lebanese President Joseph Aoun spoke by phone to discuss making elements of Musk's sprawling business empire available in Lebanon, a statement from Aoun's office said on Thursday.】

item.title: 据《华尔街日报》报道，CoreWeave 正在洽谈收购 Core Scientific
item.description: 据《华尔街日报》周四援引知情人士的话报道，CoreWeave公司正在洽谈收购Core Scientific公司，这家比特币矿商去年拒绝了这家云服务提供商早些时候提出的交易。【原文：CoreWeave is in talks to buy Core Scientific , after the bitcoin miner rejected an earlier deal from the cloud provider last year, the Wall Street Journal reported on Thursday, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: Equinix 的营收和资本支出预期令投资者失望，股价下跌
item.description: Equinix 的股价周四下跌了 8%，此前这家数据中心公司预测收入增长低于预期，并预计将进行大量投资以满足人工智能的长期需求。【原文：Equinix's shares fell 8% on Thursday after the data center firm forecast revenue growth below expectations and projected heavy investments to cater to AI demand in the long term.】

item.title: 西门子歌美飒首席运营官称，西门子歌美飒与中国磁铁供应商讨论在欧洲生产事宜
item.description: 风力涡轮机制造商西门子-歌美飒（Siemens Gamesa）正在与中国稀土永磁供应商洽谈将生产基地迁往欧洲的可能性，以减少该地区在中国限制供应后对进口的依赖。【原文：Wind turbine maker Siemens Gamesa is in talks with Chinese suppliers of rare earth permanent magnets about the possibility of bringing production to Europe, in a bid to cut the region's reliance on imports after curbs on supplies from China.】

item.title: 西门子能源公司目标于 2027 年在美国生产变压器，并进一步扩大工厂规模
item.description: 西门子能源集团的高级管理人员表示，该集团预计将于 2027 年开始在美国生产大型工业电力变压器，如果需求和进口关税居高不下，该集团还将进一步扩建夏洛特工厂。【原文：Siemens Energy is expecting to start U.S. production of big industrial power transformers in 2027 and can further expand its Charlotte factory if demand, and import tariffs, stay high, senior executives at the group said.】

item.title: 独家报道亚马逊失去 AWS 生成式 AI 老大，技术人才洗牌白热化
item.description: 随着人才竞争的白热化，亚马逊的 AWS 最近失去了主管生成式人工智能开发的副总裁。【原文：Amazon's AWS recently lost its vice president overseeing generative artificial intelligence development, as the competition for talent heats up.】

item.title: 巴克莱银行前首席执行官斯塔利必须面对美国股东就杰弗里-爱泼斯坦关系提起的诉讼
item.description: 巴克莱银行（Barclays）和前首席执行官杰斯-斯塔利（Jes Staley）必须面对洛杉矶的一项诉讼，该诉讼声称他们欺骗了股东，因为斯塔利与已故金融家杰弗里-爱泼斯坦（Jeffrey Epstein）关系密切。【原文：Barclays and former Chief Executive Jes Staley must face a lawsuit in Los Angeles claiming they defrauded shareholders about Staley's close ties to the disgraced late financier Jeffrey Epstein.】

item.title: 美国证券交易委员会、瑞波公司希望就加密货币诉讼达成和解，但遭到美国法官拒绝
item.description: 周四，一名联邦法官驳回了瑞波实验室（Ripple Labs）和美国证券交易委员会（U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission）提出的一项不同寻常的联合动议，即批准该加密货币公司减免 5000 万美元罚款，以了结因销售未注册证券而引发的民事诉讼。【原文：A federal judge on Thursday rejected an unusual joint motion by Ripple Labs and the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission to endorse the cryptocurrency company's reduced $50 million fine to settle a civil lawsuit over the sale of unregistered securities.】
